Sophia opens up to Jemele about her path into the hip-hop industry as a Korean-Canadian woman, and why she’s the self-proclaimed “baddest bitch in the room.” She explains how immersing herself into hip-hop culture and Wu-Tang sparked her own “Asian Renaissance.” Sophia also helps Jemele settle a heated debate between her and Ian about who is the leader of The Wu-Tang. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 60: STAN VAN GUNDY - The Pepsi Swig
item.description: The always candid former NBA coach and current TNT analyst opens up to Jemele about his relationships with Shaq and Dwight Howard and why he chooses Lebron over MJ. He also sets the record straight on what really happened at the end of his tenure with Pat Riley and the Miami Heat. Plus, Stan gives his opinion on the NBA-China saga and why he refuses to “stick to sports.”   Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 59: NEIL BROWN JR. - Sip The Juice
item.description: The star of CBS’ ‘Seal Team’ and Lawrence’s juice sipping best friend on ‘Insecure’ drops by to share how martial arts turned into an acting career. He discusses all things ‘Insecure’, including his thoughts on #LawrenceHive. He also tells Jemele what it was like to get the co-sign from Dr. Dre and Ice Cube for his role as DJ Yella in ‘Straight Outta Compton’. And with 19 years of marriage under his belt, Neil drops some gems for a now newlywed Jemele. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 58: SETH MEYERS - A "Two-Fer"
item.description: The SNL alum and ‘Late Night with Seth Meyers’ host joins Jemele to discuss his comedic journey, and his new Netflix special ‘Lobby Baby.’ Seth also shares his thoughts on the fondness, or lack thereof President Trump has for him, he also gives us the inside scoop on what it’s like to get drunk with Rihanna. And of course Jemele and Seth unpack the final season of ‘Game of Thrones.’ Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 57: IAN WALLACE - We UnBothered
item.description: Jemele’s fiance, Ian Wallace, joins the podcast to discuss their upcoming wedding. They also discuss how they met, their first date, and why the time was right for marriage. They both also admit their biggest fears heading into marriage, and they try to find common ground over their differences — Ian’s lukewarm feelings toward the Wu Tang Clan and Jemele’s refusal to root for his favorite NFL team, the Detroit Lions. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 56: THE BRIDESMAIDS - We Classy and Stuff
item.description: Jemele sits down with the six Bridesmaids in her upcoming wedding — Kelley Carter, Cari Champion, Dej Peyton, Chantre Camack, Jameka Peyton, and Amina Hussein. They discuss the roots of their friendship, and give their honest thoughts on Jemele’s fiancé. They also share some marital advice with Jemele and discuss which of the bridesmaids is most likely to hook up with someone at the wedding.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 55: SNOOP DOGG - The Gangsta Professional
item.description: Snoop Dogg joins Jemele for an all-encompassing conversation about his life and career. He discusses how he‘s maintained his authenticity despite massive commercial success, reflects on his days as a Death Row artist, and his friendships with both Biggie and Tupac. Snoop also shares why he never liked ‘Pac’s diss track, “Hit Em Up’” and if there will ever be a movie made about Death Row.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 54: VAN LATHAN - Life Between Cheat Meals
item.description: Van Lathan joins Jemele to discuss being fired from TMZ, and what he plans to do next. He also discusses his famous confrontation with Kanye West, his weight loss journey and his upcoming book.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 53: OMAR GOODING - Fresh Pedicure Confidence
item.description: Actor and producer Omar Gooding joins Jemele Hill to discuss what it’s like acting, producing and writing for the Bounce TV sitcom “Family Time,” which is in its seventh season. He also discusses what it was like growing up in a family full of entertainers, and why he never resented the success of his brother, Cuba Gooding Jr. Plus, Omar shares the incredible backstory behind his starring role in the now-defunct show, “Playmakers.” The Laker superfan also explains why he considers himself a “Kobeist.” Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 52: RAJON RONDO - Call a Spade a Spade
item.description: Los Angeles Lakers point guard Rajon Rondo joins Jemele to discuss whether championship expectations for the Lakers this season are fair, his desire to be a coach and general manager some day, and how much longer he sees himself playing in the NBA. He also discusses playing with LeBron James as opposed to competing against him, and how he sees LeBron and Anthony Davis meshing together as teammates.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 51: ROY WOOD JR. - Selling Tapes Out Of The Trunk
item.description: Comedian Roy Wood Jr. joins Jemele to discuss how ‘cancel culture’ has impacted comedians, and how the business of comedy has changed. He also discusses how he got his start, his work on Comedy Central’s ’The Daily Show,’ and he shares the story of how shoplifting at Dillard’s led to his career at comedy. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 50: BEBE WINANS - Born For This
item.description: Gospel legend BeBe Winans joins Jemele to discuss his new book, “Born For This,” how he overcame a gambling addiction, his close friendship with Whitney Houston and how he formed a successful duo with his sister, CeCe. He also discusses his new solo album, “Need You.” Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 49: SEN. CORY BOOKER - The Impotency of Empathy
item.description: New Jersey Senator and presidential candidate Cory Booker joins Jemele to discuss the Donald Trump impeachment inquiry, why Americans shouldn’t feel disillusioned by the current state of American politics, and how he’s preparing for the upcoming presidential debate. He also shares his aggressive plan to combat the exploitation of college athletes, and prevent professional sports owners from colluding against players. He also confesses something that might get him in trouble with his girlfriend, actress Rosario Dawson.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 48: MAYA MOORE - Colossians 3:23
item.description: WNBA superstar Maya Moore joins Jemele to discuss her decision to not play the 2019 WNBA season in order to focus on overturning the conviction of Johnathan Irons, who received a 50-year sentence after being convicted of a nonfatal shooting of a homeowner during a burglary, despite questionable evidence. Moore addresses whether she plans to return to basketball in 2020, what she’s learned about herself away from the game, and how she is using her criminal justice reform organization, Win With Justice, to create change. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 47: TARANA BURKE - The Valleys Will Kill You
item.description: Tarana Burke, the founder of the #MeToo movement, joins Jemele to discuss the two-year anniversary of the powerful campaign that gave sexual abuse survivors a voice and created an international conversation. She discusses the progress the movement, and how media coverage has undermined the true messaging of #MeToo. She also explains the many misconceptions about sexual violence, how we need to address what consent means for both genders and how black women in particular have struggled to find intra-community support when it comes to the sexual violence they experience. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 46: BOKEEM WOODBINE - Warning: This Person Is Different Than He Appears
item.description: Actor Bokeem Woodbine joins Jemele to discuss his 20-plus years in the business, his role in the upcoming film “Queen & Slim,” and how he handled being in a career slump. He also opens up about how his physical appearance made it easier to be typecast. Plus, he shares the story of how him and Tupac bonded over smoking marijuana. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 45: LARENZ TATE - Brother To The Night
item.description: Actor Larenz Tate joins Jemele to discuss the final season of his hit show ‘Power’, how he landed the role as Councilman Rashad Tate and why fans of the show are so dedicated. He also discusses some of his iconic roles in Menace II Society, Love Jones, Why Do Fools Fall in Love and Dead Presidents.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 44: CANDACE PARKER - Never Cheat The Game
item.description: WNBA star and Turner Sports basketball analyst Candace Parker joins Jemele to discuss her 12th season with the Los Angeles Sparks, and her favorite memories of her former college coach, Pat Summitt. She also shares the story of dunking on a Tennessee men’s basketball player, how being a parent has changed her, her broadcasting career and how she concerned she is with whether her numerous injuries will impact her quality of life. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 43: NICOLE LYNN - A Different Level of Grit
item.description: Sports agent Nicole Lynn joins Jemele to discuss becoming the first black woman to ever represent a top-5 pick in the 2019 NFL draft and also just the third woman ever in the draft’s 83-year history to rep a first rounder. She shares the story of how she landed New York Jets defensive tackle Quinnen Williams, the third overall pick, as a client. She also discusses how she manages the different challenges she faces as a black female sports agent, and what it’s like working for Lil Wayne’s Young Money Sports. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 42: TEDDY RILEY - The Music Man
item.description: Historic hitmaker Teddy Riley joins Jemele for a deep dive into his origin story. He discusses what encouraged him to pursue music, how his career almost never happened because of an early drug arrest as a teenager, and how he came up with “New Jack Swing.” Having produced both Michael Jackson and Prince, Teddy also shares his insight into their rivalry and creative genius. Plus, he settles the debate about which was the better album: Thriller or Off The Wall? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 41: JESSE WILLIAMS - It’s A Love Movement
item.description: Grey’s Anatomy star Jesse Williams joins Jemele to discuss why the show has resonated with people for so long, and what he’s learned from Grey’s creator Shonda Rhimes. Jesse also discusses his deep involvement in activism, why it’s important to him and whether he worried his passion for social justice issues would cost him Hollywood opportunities.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 40: JOHNNY GILL - The Game Changer
item.description: R&B legend Johnny Gill joins Jemele to discuss his new album “Game Changer II,” and why he’s excelled at making classic love songs. He also discusses the latest conflict within New Edition, and why he believes the iconic group will eventually reunite.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 39: DEBORAH JOY WINANS - Nothing But God
item.description: Actress Deborah Joy Winans joins Jemele to discuss the new season of her hit television show, “Greenleaf.” She also discusses why she chose acting over singing, despite growing up in a famous gospel family and shares the incredible story of how Oprah Winfrey discovered her. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 38: DAVID OYELOWO - Royalty
item.description: Actor David Oyelowo joins Jemele to discuss his new movie, ‘Don’t Let Go,’ a supernatural thriller that hits theaters on August 30th. David also discusses how he’s handled playing historical figures such as Martin Luther King Jr, and Tuskegee airman Joe “Lightning” Little. He also shares the story of his royal lineage. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 37: LUTHER CAMPBELL - Parental Advisory
item.description: Hip hop legend Luther Campbell joins Jemele to discuss his music, life, career and passions, which include sports and politics. Jemele and Luke dive into how 2 Live Crew’s landmark Supreme Court case impacted the conversation about free speech. Luke also discusses 2 Live Crew’s bitter breakup, offers thoughts on the Democratic presidential field and explains why there should be a black-owned sports network. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 36: ROBIN THEDE - A Black Lady Podcast
item.description: Robin Thede, creator and star of the new HBO sketch series ‘A Black Lady Sketch Show,’ joins Jemele to discuss why she specifically created a comedy show for only black women, and why she believes black women in comedy often are treated as invisible. She also shares her dream list of black women she’d like to see perform in sketches on her show, and explains what life was like growing up in a trailer park in Iowa. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 35: RAPHAEL SAADIQ - Town Business
item.description: The multi-talented Raphael Saadiq joins Jemele to discuss his new album Jimmy Lee, his first solo project in eight years. Raphael also discusses what it was like touring with Prince at 19 years old, and the breakup of his revolutionary R & B band Tony! Toni! Tone! Plus, he shares the backstory behind some of his most iconic love songs. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 34: VINCE STAPLES - Straight Up, No Chaser
item.description: Hip-hop artist Vince Staples joins Jemele live from Capitol Music Group's 6th annual Capitol Congress music event to discuss his upcoming project, “The Vince Staples Show.” Vince also discusses his upbringing in Long Beach, and what led him to a rap career, even though he had never listened to Jay-Z, Nas or many other rap legends before he began performing. He also shares candid opinions on why he didn’t like Kobe Bryant as a basketball player, and why he doesn’t believe Tupac’s “Dear Mama” wouldn’t be a hit in present day.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 33: NIECY NASH - Working Not Twerking
item.description: Actor Niecy Nash joins Jemele to discuss her starring role as Desna Simms, the female boss on TNT’s ‘Claws.’ Niecy also discusses starting her acting career as a wife and mother of three children, and what it’s like being Shaq’s neighbor. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 32: RICK ROSS - That Rozay Seasoning
item.description: Rapper and boss Rick Ross joins Jemele to discuss his new album, “Port of Miami 2,” the follow-up to his classic debut in 2006. He also reveals why he has such strong chemistry with Drake, and if fans can expect a collaboration album between the two hip-hop heavyweights in the future. Plus, Rozay ranks his 10 albums. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 31: KARRUECHE TRAN - Just Keep Going
item.description: Actor Karrueche Tran joins Jemele to discuss her hit television show “Claws,” how she dealt with sudden fame and the difficulties of getting people to take her seriously as an actor. She also lists her favorite Atlanta strip clubs, and how studying strippers in the Atlanta clubs helped her prepare for her role on “Claws.” Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 30: MARSAI MARTIN - A Little One Doing Big Things
item.description: 14-year-old actress and producer Marsai Martin joins Jemele to discuss finding her passion at a young age, becoming the youngest person in Hollywood with a production deal, and how her film, ‘Little,’ changed the game for her. Her parents, Joshua and Carol, also join the podcast to discuss what it’s like raising a child star. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 29: IBTIHAJ MUHAMMAD - Faith & Race
item.description: Former Olympic fencer Ibtihaj Muhammad joins Jemele to discuss her experience in the 2016 Olympics, where she became the first Muslim American woman to win a medal and the first woman in a hijab to compete for Team USA at the Olympics. She also reveals why she won’t be competing in the 2020 games, and the difficulty of being an African-American Muslim woman in a climate that encourages hostility toward people with her faith. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 28: MUSIQ SOULCHILD - Triggers and Trauma
item.description: Hip-hop soul artist Musiq Soulchild joins Jemele to discuss the evolution of his music career, why he rejects being labeled as only a R & B artist, and next year being the 20th anniversary of his debut smash album Aijuswanaseing. He also discusses what it’s like running his own label, co-parenting and divulges which one of his classic songs he hates to sing.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 27: BARRINGTON IRVING - Reaching New Heights
item.description: Barrington Irving is the first African-American to fly around to world solo, and youngest person to ever do so. He joins Jemele to discuss his incredible feat, the many dangers he faced on his unlikely journey, and why he chose aviation over a promising football career. He also discusses his relationship with slain teenager Trayvon Martin, who was his former aviation student.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 26: BETO O'ROURKE - Through the Fire
item.description: Presidential candidate Beto O’Rourke joins Jemele to discuss why he remains optimistic despite the tumultuous political and social climate, what motivates him as a politician, and why he’s confident he can boost his sagging poll numbers. He also discusses his policy positions on student loan debt, and gun control. Plus, Jemele puts Beto on the hot seat about a controversial issue: If you’re binge-watching a TV show with your significant other, is it acceptable to watch episodes without them? Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 25: KAMALA HARRIS - Starts with a ‘M,’ ends with an ‘A
item.description: Presidential candidate Kamala Harris joins Jemele for a wide-ranging conversation on why she went after former Vice President Joe Biden during the first democratic debate, and why she feels she can beat Donald Trump. She also shares her positions on marijuana legalization, the racial wealth gap, and reparations. Plus, the California senator reveals her favorite curse word.  Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: Ep 24: WALTER MOSELY - Writing is sex
item.description: Bestselling novelist Walter Mosley joins Jemele to discuss his work as a writer and consultant for the late John Singleton’s FX drama, “Snowfall.” He also discusses the secret to his longevity, why he decided to bring back his iconic character Easy Rawlings, and why he believes drugs should be legalized. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.description: La La Anthony joins Jemele to discuss how she stays booked and busy. La La shares how she evolved from being an MTV VJ to an actress, author, producer and activist. item.description: Rotimi joins Jemele to discuss his success as both an actor and singer. He shares what it means to have both a hit album (“Walk With Me”) and hit TV show (“Power”). He also explains why music is his first love, why nobody should take 50 Cent’s trolling personally and what it meant for him to pay for his first house in cash. Learn more about your ad choices. item.description: Renowned filmmaker Spike Lee joins Jemele to discuss the 30th anniversary of his iconic film, “Do The Right Thing,” and why he’ll never give up his New York Knicks fandom. Jemele and Spike also debate the best Spike Lee movies of all time. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep 20: LIL' REL HOWERY - America’s Best Friend
item.description: Actor and comedian Lil’ Rel Howery joins Jemele to discuss his uniquely personal brand of comedy, what went right and wrong with his network sitcom ‘Rel,’ and how his Chicago roots shaped his comedy. item.description: Renowned filmmaker Ava Duvernay joins Jemele to discuss her critically-acclaimed limited series, “When They See Us,” a gripping drama about the Central Park 5’s journey to exoneration. Ava also reveals why she’s drawn to stories that address the injustice people of color face in the criminal justice system. Plus, Ava also shares what it was like directing Jay-Z and Beyonce, and how she became close friends with Oprah. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Ep. 18: Revenge of the Stans
item.description: Michael Arcenaux and Cole Wiley join Jemele to discuss how the Beyhive claimed another victim during the NBA Finals, and which celebrities have the worst fans. Also, Michael, Jemele and Cole give their thoughts on Ava DuVernay’s new critically-acclaimed Netflix series, “When They See Us.” Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.description: Actress Tichina Arnold joins Jemele to discuss her new critically-acclaimed movie, “Last Black Man In San Francisco,” and to reminisce about her time on the iconic television show, “Martin.” She also gives the tea on whether there will be a Martin reboot, and why she’s found a lane with network sitcoms.  Learn more about your ad choices. item.description: Metta World Peace, also known as Ron Artest, joins Jemele to discuss the new Showtime documentary on his life, “Quiet Storm.” Metta discusses the infamous “Malice at The Palace” brawl, which nearly destroyed his NBA career. item.description: Comedic legend Katt Williams joins Jemele Hill to discuss his Emmy Award winning performance in the hit series “Atlanta,” and why his upcoming Netflix special will be his best one yet. item.description: CNN host Don Lemon joins Jemele to discuss his recent engagement, and how he’s changed perceptions of gay black men in America. item.description: Rapper and actor Common joins Jemele to discuss his why he chose to reveal he was sexually molested in his new memoir, “Let Love Have The Last Word.” Plus, he shares his approach to fatherhood, and how a high school basketball injury motivated him to get serious about rap. item.description: Former Georgia gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams joins Jemele to discuss her controversial loss in the governor’s race, and if her next step is running for president. item.description: How did actor and comedian Tone Bell go from being a first-grade teacher to starring in Issa Rae and Marsai Martin’s new film, “Little”? item.title: Ep 02: KILLER MIKE - "Up Negro Creek"
item.description: Rapper and entrepreneur Killer Mike joins Jemele to dive deep into Nipsey Hussle’s legacy, and how he and other notable hip hop artists are trying to leave a different financial blueprint for today’s rappers. item.title: Ep 01: Death and Taxes
